oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Ralph Emery Interviews Irlene Mandrell and Louise Mandrell - Parts 1, 2 and 3
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Recording is from Ralph Emery's (entertainer) interview of Louise Mandrell (performer) and Irlene Mandrell (performer) for the Ralph Emery Show. Tape labeled parts 1, 2, and 3. Recording is from April 10, 1984.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Ralph Emery; Irlene Mandrell; Louise Mandrell
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:06) Louise Mandrell and Irlene Mandrell radio spot for the Ralph Emery Show -- (00:18) Ralph Emery introduces Louise and Irlene, and they introduce "Burning Out of Control" -- (01:38) Louise reveals how she came up for the title of her title track "I'm Not Through Loving You Yet" and the difficulties of signing -- (04:41) Emery addresses Irlene and her artistic tastes -- (07:12) Emery inquires about the Mandrell sister's dancing habits -- (08:01) Emery introduces George Jones' "You've Still Got a Place in My Heart" -- (08:23) Irlene recalls working with Buck White while introducing the Whites' "When the New Wears Off Our Love" -- (09:25) Emery introduces the Louise Mandrell Country Music Trivia Game and Louise explains why she decided to release the game -- (13:09) Emery inquires Irlene about the time Kenny Rogers was on the Mandrell Show -- (13:57) Emery questions where Barbara Mandrell is during the time of the interview -- (15:53) Emery expresses his thanks to Louise and Irlene -- (16:24) Emery introduces Irlene and Louise, and Louise describes her opinion of George Strait -- (17:36) Emery reveals Irlene has an album, and Irlene reveals it to be an exercise album -- (21:12) Irlene and Louise recall a birthday party for Barbara -- (23:40) The Glaser Brothers' success is reflected on by Emery "Sweet City Woman" -- (24:13) Emery introduces Irlene to discuss how she met her husband, Ric Boyer -- (27:00) Irlene reveals she was not invited to Louise's marriage to R. C. Bannon -- (28:24) Emery inquires whether or not Louise and Irlene ever performed on Barbara's traveling band -- (31:37) Emery expresses his thanks to Louise and Irlene and they all say goodbye -- (32:31) Emery introduces Irlene and Louise while discussing The Mandrell Family Album -- (33:21) Louise Mandrell discusses the circumstances that led to Louise and Irlene to join the Do Rights; additionally, Louise reveals how Barbara burned her hand -- (35:22) Emery inquires about Louise's experience with the Statler Brothers -- (36:26) Emery and Louise discuss how Louise and Irlene went with Barbara to Germany while Barbara was pregnant -- (39:26) Emery invites Louise to discuss her inspiration for "You're a Hard Act to Follow" -- (40:28) Emery questions Irlene about the word 'dingy' and Louise defends her intelligence -- (41:38) Emery inquires about the reasons for the dumb moments Irlene would have on the Mandrell Show and the moments that had inspiration from real life -- (44:57) Emery inquires about the influence Irby Mandrell has on the girls, and his management of their careers -- (46:46) Emery says goodbye to the audience and the Mandrell sisters
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Emery, Ralph; Mandrell, Irlene; Mandrell, Louise;
